decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations comprising the erection of a rear roof extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations comprising the installation of a rooflight to the front roof slope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The development is only just within Permitted Development tolerances in terms of volume. You are advised to complete the development in full accordance with the plans, as if the development is larger than that covered by this Certificate a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 4 - The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for Swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of Swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of a Swift nesting box/bricks on the site.
description: APPLICATION FOR A CERTIFICATE OF LAWFULNESS FOR THE ERECTION AN L-SHAPED REAR ROOF EXTENSION
